Eifel Natural Park.name: Eifel Natural Park
Eifel Natural Park.contacts: booking and advice center reachable by phone on 02441 994570 or directly at Nordeifel Tourismus GmbH
Eifel Natural Park.description: You can pitch your tent in the Eifel Natural Park, in North Rhine-Westphalia, legally. The park offers multiple natural camping locations and you can select yours during the booking phase. Each natural camp site is equipped with a composting toilet and offers space for up to two tents on a tent platform. All locations are only accessible on foot via hiking trails. You are on your own and you have to bring your own food. It is not possible to camp in winter, from November 1st until March 31st.

Barmstedt - Wildes.name: Barmstedt - Wildes
Barmstedt - Wildes.description: This overnight place is kindly offered by private owners and is located a little outside of Barmstedt on a large, quiet and natural private property. Sanitary rooms are not available. Pre-registration is not necessary.

Blomnath - Wildes.name: Blomnath - Wildes
Blomnath - Wildes.description: This area is near Blomnat, part ​​the Nature Conservation Foundation and offered by Ulrike and Jürgen Kaldewey from Seedorf. It is required to book for an overnight stay via email or phone.

Drage - Wildes.name: Drage - Wildes
Drage - Wildes.contacts: the provider of the overnight accommodation, Ms. Ute Gröne, can be reached at 04881-7797
Drage - Wildes.description: This place is in a 2500 square meter orchard in Drage. There are benches and tables and bicycles can be stored in a shed if necessary. A washroom with toilet and a shower are in the house but can be reached from outside through a separate entrance. This place is only 1.5 kilometers away from a swimming area and a canoe insertion point on the Eider. Booking via phone is required.

Eidertal - Wildes.name: Eidertal - Wildes
Eidertal - Wildes.description: This area, located in the Eider Valley, is surrounded by bushes and it is near a railway and a hiking trail. The vegetation and a the uneven ground offer a protection from the wind. Sanitary rooms are not available. It is not necessary to register in advance to camp on the area.

Enge-Sande - Wildes.name: Enge-Sande - Wildes
Enge-Sande - Wildes.description: This place is located at the edge of the Langenberger Forst state forest near the municipality of Enge-Sande. A farm road leads from Enger-Strasse up into the forest. The small camping area, is surrounded by both old and young trees and has a view of arable land and of the village. About 100m away there is a small pond that usually has water. There are no sanitary rooms. Registration is not required.

Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes.name: Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes
Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes.description: This place is publicly accessible and located in the area of ​​the Trappenkamp adventure forest. The site is accessible also when the Trappenkamp Adventure Forest's is closed. No booking is required.

Gieselau valley - Wildes.name: Gieselau valley - Wildes
Gieselau valley - Wildes.description: This place is publicly accessible and located in the area of ​​the Stone Age Park in Albersdorf. The replica of the large stone grave of Frestedt can also be found here. There are no sanitary rooms available. Registration is not required.

Gruber See - Wildes.name: Gruber See - Wildes
Gruber See - Wildes.contacts: phone (+494364471866) and email (post@meeresbrise.de). Contact in advance required.
Gruber See - Wildes.description: This place is in a farm where the owners are happy to offer the opportunity to pitch a tent for one night. The Mönchsweg, the international long-distance cycle path from Bremen to the Baltic Sea island of Fehmarn, is just next to the farm. For each stay, registration by phone or email is required.
Gruber See - Wildes.accessibility: This place is only available for bicycle travellers

Hattstedt - Wildes.name: Hattstedt - Wildes
Hattstedt - Wildes.contacts: for any questions contact 0175 7494094 or just drop by
Hattstedt - Wildes.description: This is a private campsite located in a yard in Hattstedt-Feld, 4 km north of Husum, near the North Sea Cycle Route and the Schobüller Forest. A compost toilet, tap and fireplace are available and may be used.

Hessenstein - Wildes.name: Hessenstein - Wildes
Hessenstein - Wildes.description: This place is an open space near a old quarry, right on the hiking trail. It is provided by the Nature Conservation Foundation in the Hessenstein Foundation State. Attractions such as the Tower Hill Castle and the Ice Age Museum are nearby.
Hessenstein - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (the sites are aimed exclusively at hikers or cyclists, parking vehicles is not allowed)

Husby - Wildes.name: Husby - Wildes
Husby - Wildes.description: This place is provided by the Danish scouts from Husby. The site is located near a pond and has also a shelter as a covered overnight accommodation, so it can also be used without a tent. There are no toilets available and there is a fire place with seating that can be used carefully but with your own wood.

Kolonistenhof - Wildes.name: Kolonistenhof - Wildes
Kolonistenhof - Wildes.description: This place is located at the edge of the Hüttener Berge, an nice area of ​​around 18 hectares with hiking trails. Nature lovers who would like to spend a night under the starry sky have the opportunity to spend the night here. The total camping area is of ​​approx. 500 m² and is located behind the baking house, the first building to the right of the entrance. Sanitary facilities are available.

Koppelheck - Wildes.name: Koppelheck - Wildes
Koppelheck - Wildes.description: This place, provided by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation, is right on the Baltic Sea Cycle Route. It is a small area between two pastures, directly behind the dike, from which it is possible to enjoy the sea view.
Koppelheck - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (no access via the north street, you can get to the bike/hiking trail north via the beach car park in Ohrfeldhaff or east at Geltingmole)

Kosel - Wildes.name: Kosel - Wildes
Kosel - Wildes.description: This place is a little outside of Kosel, on a hiking trail near forests between a pasture and a dog free run area. The landscape is excellent for observing animals such as deer, fallow deer, hares, the eagle owl, black woodpecker and kingfisher. In the village there is a shop where you can stock up on essentials. There is a small swimming area at the Bültsee, right in the nature reserve, and another a swimming area on the Schlei. This place is kindly offered by Thiemo Florek from Kosel and it is not necessary to register for the overnight stay.

Kuden - Wildes.name: Kuden - Wildes
Kuden - Wildes.description: This place is on the area of ​​the former waterworks offered by the municipality of Kuden, as part of the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. Registration is not required and the campsite can be freely chosen on the area. Sanitary rooms are not available.
Kuden - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (the area can be entered from the street Am Wasserwerk via a gate)

Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.name: Mönchneversdorf - Wildes
Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.contacts: by email: info@ferienhof-schnoor.de or by phone: 04528/846 (Dirk and Alexandra Schnoor)
Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.description: This space is part of the Schnoor holiday farm, directly below Bungsberg, between Mönchneversdorf and Kirchmühlen. You can camp in the pasture and if the weather is bad, you can stay overnight on hay and straw in the horse stable. The place is next to the European hiking trail and near lakes, ponds and forests. Many different animals live on site: horses, ponies, a donkey, 2 pigs, 2 goats, Eddi the dog, chickens, Johannes the rooster, rabbits, guinea pigs and some cats. Fishing is also possible in the area. Prior registration is required.

Olendieksau - Wildes.name: Olendieksau - Wildes
Olendieksau - Wildes.description: This overnight place is offered by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. The site is located directly on a hiking trail with a view of the pastures. There is a small wooden seating area on site. There is also a fence that carries a relatively strong current - please do not touch it! As a possible excursion destination, the Langwedel village museum is also not far from the place.
Olendieksau - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (if you drive on the L298 from Langwedel in the direction of Nortorf, turn left into the Moorweg opposite the Waldheim on the right)

Rabel - Wildes.name: Rabel - Wildes
Rabel - Wildes.description: This private place to stay is in the small village of Rabel between the Schlei and the Baltic Sea - very close to Kappeln. It is 3 km to the Schlei, 7 km to the Baltic Sea and 10 km to the Geltinger Birk foundation. A hiking trail through the Feldmark, past Gut Buckhagen, leads to this wonderful place to stay. Deer, hedgehogs, foxes and squirrels are at home here. Marten and bats also feel at home here. Feathered friends from sparrows and cranes to eagles and eagle owls delight the ornithologist's heart. Not far away is the Barefoot Park and the Massholm / Oehe nature adventure center. The sleeping space is offered on private land in your own garden and requires prior registration with the owners! There is a separate toilet and shower.

Schäferhaus - Wildes.name: Schäferhaus - Wildes
Schäferhaus - Wildes.description: This overnight place is offered by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. The site is located in the Schäferhaus foundation state (Schleswig-Flensburg district), a former military training area. At this overnight place, the tent can be pitched near the sculpture next to the famous Ochsenweg, a historic country road. You can't miss the place to stay because of the wooden sculpture standing there, which depicts two symbolic ox horns.

Segeberger Heide - Wildes.name: Segeberger Heide - Wildes
Segeberger Heide - Wildes.description: The Schleswig-Holstein State Forests are offering this overnight accommodation in the forest as part of the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. In the season, a “Dixi toilet” and a garbage container are set up at the forest playground. Barbecuing is allowed at this overnight place.

Steinbergkirche - Wildes.name: Steinbergkirche - Wildes
Steinbergkirche - Wildes.contacts: Registration is mandatory via our e-mail address: hdbrix@t-online.de
Steinbergkirche - Wildes.description: Our no longer managed farm is located in the Westerholm district of the Steinbergkirche community. The Baltic Sea and the Baltic Sea Cycle Route are approx. 7 km away. The campground is located on a meadow behind the garden. By arrangement, it is possible to use an outdoor kitchen equipped with the essentials. This also applies to a toilet and shower facility in the main house. Registration is mandatory via our e-mail address: hdbrix@t-online.de

St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes.name: St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes
St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes.description: This overnight place of the Nature Conservation Foundation is located in a small forest in the municipality of St. Michaelisdonn (Dithmarschen). It offers a view of the Kleve nature reserve with the so-called Spiekerberg. The Spiekerberg is an impressive witness of the times - it is the former edge of the North Sea (Kleve = cliff). When the heather is in bloom, this mountain is particularly beautiful to look at in the middle of the rather flat landscape. There are hiking trails through the nature reserve. At the overnight place there is mainly one thing: nature. There are no seats, rubbish bins, water or sanitary facilities. The overnight place is in the FFH area, fire is not permitted.

Süderlügum - Wildes.name: Süderlügum - Wildes
Süderlügum - Wildes.description: This is a place to stay at the Süderlügum youth forest home offered by the state forests in the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. The square is located southwest of the JWH building, approx. 150 m away by a small pond. The site is open to the public.

Winderatter See - Wildes.name: Winderatter See - Wildes
Winderatter See - Wildes.description: This overnight place is made available by the Schelswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. It is located in the picturesque foundation land on Lake Winderatter (Schleswig-Flensburg district) between fruit trees in a forestation. A stream, the Moorau , flows by nearby. The overnight place is west of the Winderatter See. Pastures and woods lie between the lake and the overnight stay.

Camping in the Palatinate Forest.name: Camping in the Palatinate Forest
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.contacts: Oline booking: https://www.trekking-pfalz.de/buchung/online-buchen/? Onsite booking: https://www.trekking-pfalz.de/de/buchung/buchungsstellen/ general contacts: contact info@suedlicheweinstrasse.de or Tel .: 06341 940 400.
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.address: After booking, you will receive the exact GPS data and directions to the desired location. There you can pitch your tent for one night and move on the next day - either to the next trekking site or to relax in the hotel. possibilities: https://www.trekking-pfalz.de/de/trekking-plaetze/uebersicht-der-plaetze/
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.description: 10 euros per tent (2-3 people) and night from April up to and including October In these places, which can be used from April up to and including October, overnight stays in the Palatinate Forest Nature Park are officially permitted for the first time. And you don't have to stray far from the familiar paths to have the feeling of being all alone with a fox and a deer in the forest. All places are a bit away from the villages and the usual hiking trails in areas that are harmless for nature and water protection. They can only be reached on foot and have up to six storage spaces, a fireplace with rustic seating and a simple toilet block. Not more. The trekkers must bring water and food. And take your rubbish home with you, that's the user policy that every guest must accept if they want to spend the night in the forest. What else should not be missing in your backpack, we have put together in our equipment   recommendations. Any questions? You can find answers to frequently asked questions here.

Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald
Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Spend the night in the middle of nature - at the FRANKENWALD Kohbach trekking site. If you want to enjoy nature with all your senses and want to spend a night under the starry sky, then the FRANKENWALD Kobach trekking area is the right place for you. Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests and was built and equipped by them. A total of four tents have space here, wooden platforms are available for two of them (there are several eyelets for attaching the lines to the platforms!) There is also a fireplace with a lighter and firewood and an outdoor toilet (the key for the toilet is in the box). Arrival possible from 1:30 p.m., departure no later than 1:00 p.m.

Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald
Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Spend the night in the middle of nature - on the FRANKENWALD Rehwiese trekking site. If you want to enjoy nature with all your senses and spend a night under the starry sky, the FRANKENWALD Rehwiese trekking site is the right place for you. Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests and was built and equipped by them. There is space for a total of four tents. There is also a fireplace with firewood and an outdoor toilet.

Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald
Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Spend the night in the middle of nature - on the FRANKENWALD Döbraberg trekking site. If you want to enjoy nature with all your senses and spend a night under the starry sky, the FRANKENWALD Döbraberg trekking site is the right place for you. Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests and was built and equipped by them. There is space for a total of four tents. There is also a fireplace with firewood and an outdoor toilet.

Spessart - Bayern.name: Spessart - Bayern
Spessart - Bayern.description: The trekking sites may be used with a maximum of five tents (for 2-3 people each) and only with a valid booking confirmation. By submitting the form, you are making a non-binding inquiry to the Spessart Association. The Spessartbund will contact you as soon as possible to complete the booking with you. Please note: You will only receive the exact coordinates of our tent sites after we have received the amount. You will receive the invoice details in an email that we will send you after your booking request. If you have any questions about your booking or for further information, please contact the Spessartbund

Steigerwald - Bayern.name: Steigerwald - Bayern
Steigerwald - Bayern.description: Get out of everyday life and into adventure - exciting tours of discovery lead you through the Steigerwald Nature Park! (Flyer) A fireplace, toilet and storage space are available on ten trekking sites . You can find all trekking sites with the Steigerwald Trekking Experience app . The routes are not signposted on site. Equipped with hiking boots and a tent, you're ready to go!

Grimbach - Black Forest.name: Grimbach - Black Forest
Grimbach - Black Forest.contacts: E-Mail: contact [at] trekking-schwarzwald.de  https://naturparkschwarzwald.de/aktiv_unterwegs/trekking/?i=s  The trekking camps can be booked from March 15, 2021, from around 8 a.m., for the next trekking season from May 1 to October 31, 2021.  https://www.trekking-schwarzwald.de/ Closest rescue point: Plättig. Coordinates: N 48 ° 40.203 ' E 8 ° 13.901'  When making the emergency call, please also mention the place name “Trekking-Camp Grimbach”.
Grimbach - Black Forest.description: The Grimbach Trekking Camp is located in the Baden-Baden city forest in a beautiful beech forest. In the immediate vicinity is a small stream and a meadow. It is located between the Geroldsauer waterfall and the Plättig near the national park. Height: 670 m  Closest stops: Malschbach bus stop: bus line 204, from / to Baden-Baden  Bus stop Bühlerhöhe / Plättig: bus line 245 from / to Baden-Baden (line 245 does not run on Mondays) Bus route 263 from / to Bühl There is a small stream directly at the camp, which sometimes carries very little water or dries out completely in dry summers. To the next water source, follow the road 120 m north and then turn right into Rückegasse. Follow Rückegasse 300 m uphill to the next road, turn right, walk 40 m uphill and then turn left into the road. Follow this road for another 200 m to the first sharp left bend. Here there are water chambers with overflows and a stream. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution.
Grimbach - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Seibelseckle - Black Forest.name: Seibelseckle - Black Forest
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.contacts: E-Mail: contact [at] trekking-schwarzwald.de  https://naturparkschwarzwald.de/aktiv_unterwegs/trekking/?i=s  The trekking camps can be booked from March 15, 2021, from around 8 a.m., for the next trekking season from May 1 to October 31, 2021.  https://www.trekking-schwarzwald.de/ Closest rescue point: Plättig. Coordinates: N 48 ° 40.203 ' E 8 ° 13.901'  When making the emergency call, please also mention the place name “Trekking-Camp Grimbach”.
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.address: The Seibelseckle trekking camp is located on the northern slope of the Kesselbach valley east of the Seibelseckle. Height: 863 m  Closest stop: Seibelseckle bus stop: Bus route 7125 from / to Oppenau (on weekends) Bus route 7125 from / to Ottenhöden (Mon-Fri) Bus route 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus route F2) Mummelsee bus stop: Bus route 7123 from / to Achern
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.description: A pooled spring with a sandstone well is located on the Seibelseckle behind the rest hut. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.name: Strawberry Hole - Black Forest
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.address: The Seibelseckle trekking camp is located on the northern slope of the Kesselbach valley east of the Seibelseckle. Height: 863 m  Closest stop: Seibelseckle bus stop: Bus route 7125 from / to Oppenau (on weekends) Bus route 7125 from / to Ottenhöden (Mon-Fri) Bus route 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus route F2) Mummelsee bus stop: Bus route 7123 from / to Achern
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.description: A small stream crosses the camp. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Bösellbach - Black Forest.name: Bösellbach - Black Forest
Bösellbach - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Bösellbach - Black Forest.address: Camp Bösellbach is located in the forest near the Bösellbachhütte. Height: 766 m Closest stops: Refuge bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Alexanderschanze bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2)
Bösellbach - Black Forest.description: The Bösellbach flows directly below the camp. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution.
Bösellbach - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Gutellbach - Black Forest.name: Gutellbach - Black Forest
Gutellbach - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Gutellbach - Black Forest.address: The Gutellbach Trekking Camp is located in a side valley south of Mitteltal. It is surrounded by two streams in a small depression in the forest. Height: 640 m Closest stop: Bus stop Mitteltal, Lamm: bus route 21 from / to Baiersbronn (on weekends bus route F11) Refuge bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2)
Gutellbach - Black Forest.description: A pooled spring with a sandstone well is about 300 m away. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. At a distance of about 600 m there is a forest hut with a barbecue area. This hut can be very busy, especially on weekends.
Gutellbach - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Kniebis - Black Forest.name: Kniebis - Black Forest
Kniebis - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Kniebis - Black Forest.address: The Kniebis Trekking Camp is located in the Forbachtal, below the B 28 in the immediate vicinity of the Forbach. Height: 817 m Closest bus stop: Kniebis Waldschwimmbad: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2)
Kniebis - Black Forest.description: The Forbach flows in the immediate vicinity of the camp. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. The Kniebishütte, about 3.5 km away, is open until 7 p.m. and offers snacks and hot meals. The Avia petrol station in Kniebis with shop and bistro is open until 10 p.m. and is 1.8 km from the camp. There is a small shop at the Langenwaldsee campsite (4 km downstream). (Other refreshment stops in Kniebis: Café Günter, Waldhorn, Kniebishöhe, Hotel Waldblick, Hotel Schwarzwald).
Kniebis - Black Forest.accessibility: The trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot. As a rule, you won't find anything in the vicinity - except wild nature. To ensure that nothing goes wrong with this adventure and that the trekking tour is a safe pleasure, you should find out about possible storm warnings in advance.

Windberg - Black Forest.name: Windberg - Black Forest
Windberg - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Windberg - Black Forest.address: The Trekking Camp Windberg is located north of the Windberg waterfall in St. Blasien. You will receive the so-called last mile by email after booking. It contains the exact GPS coordinates. Height: 810 m above sea level NN Bus stop St. Blasien Albtalstraße: Bus route 7319 from / to St. Blasien bus station
Windberg - Black Forest.description: A pooled spring with a wooden well is located directly on the square. Please make sure that no food remains in the fountain trough when washing the dishes. The Windbergbach also flows in the immediate vicinity of the camp. Water can be fetched there. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. As a precaution, please boil the water from wells, springs and streams. Sources can dry up in drought. Make a fire: there is firewood. Firing is only permitted in the stone fireplace provided for this purpose. Please only use your camping stove directly on the attached fireplace. There is an old feeding hut (closed) on the site. If necessary, you can hang wet clothes under the roof overhang. Restaurants, shops and the absolutely worth seeing Blasius Cathedral in St. Blasien (approx. 2 km, 30 minutes) The rustic Windberghof is within sight (1.4 km, 20 minutes). Goat cheese and sausage from the farm. At the Windberghof, two large herd guard dogs, which you can hear at night, guard the goats and cattle. Don't worry, the dogs will stay with the herd.
Windberg - Black Forest.accessibility: It is not possible or allowed to drive to the trekking camps. If you would like to travel by car to a suitable starting point for the start of your hike or overnight stay in our camps, please park your car on onepublic Parking lot and walk the last meters to the camp behind you.

Quarry - Black Forest.name: Quarry - Black Forest
Quarry - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Quarry - Black Forest.address: The Steinbruch Trekking Camp is idyllically located in a small forest near the Schleifbach in Menzenschwand-Vorderdorf. You will receive the so-called last mile by email after booking. It contains the exact GPS coordinates. Height: 876 m above sea level NN Closest stop: Menzenschwand Vorderdorf bus stop: Bus route 7321 from / to St. Blasien bus station
Quarry - Black Forest.description: The Schleifbach is located directly at the camp with direct access. Please wash at least 50 m from the stream. Please also note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. As a precaution, please boil the water from springs and streams. Sources can dry up in drought. Make a fire: there is firewood. Firing is only permitted in the stone fireplace provided for this purpose. Please only use your camping stove directly on the attached fireplace. Restaurants and bakery in Menzenschwand (approx. 1 km, 15 minutes)
Quarry - Black Forest.accessibility: It is not possible or allowed to drive to the trekking camps. If you would like to travel by car to a suitable starting point for the start of your hike or overnight stay in our camps, please park your car on onepublic Parking lot and walk the last meters to the camp behind you.

Felsenhalde - Black Forest.name: Felsenhalde - Black Forest
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.contacts: The Erdbeerloch trekking camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. Closest stops: Schliffkopf bus stop: bus line 12 from / to Freudenstadt (on weekends bus line F2) Allerheiligen bus stop: Bus route 7125 from Oppenau (only on weekends!)
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.address: The “Felsenhalde” trekking camp is located south of Dachsberg-Urberg. You will receive the so-called last mile by email after booking. It contains the exact GPS coordinates. Height: 905 m above sea level NN Closest stop: Urberg bus stop: Bus route 7324 from / to St. Blasien bus station
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.description: At the Goldenhof there is a fountain that is suitable for fetching water. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Make a fire: there is firewood. Firing is only permitted in the stone fireplace provided for this purpose. Please only use your camping stove directly on the attached fireplace. At the nearby Goldenhof you can buy milk on request and, depending on the season, possibly products from our own farm. At the camp there is also a small hut on stands, which can be used as a shelter if the caretaker is asked to do so in extremely bad weather. On the Albsteig in the Goldenhof area you can visit the four stations of the Zeidler path (wild beekeeping):  www.goldenhof.de
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.accessibility: It is not possible or allowed to drive to the trekking camps. If you would like to travel by car to a suitable starting point for the start of your hike or overnight stay in our camps, please park your car on onepublic Parking lot and walk the last meters to the camp behind you.
